intro: Cheilosoria allosuroides, commonly known as the red-flowered dandelion, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its bright orange to red composite flowers. The plant has basal leaves that are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs. It produces a capsule fruit that contains numerous tiny seeds with pappus for wind dispersal. Cheilosoria allosuroides thrives in grassy areas and is often found in disturbed soils.
